“Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.” ― Martin Luther King Jr., A Testament of Hope: The Essential Writings and Speeches

“Are you okay?” Gemma asked me for what felt like the millionth time this morning.

Harry had been gone for a few weeks now while he did the South American leg of the tour. I was scared and a little nerve wracked on being without him after Luke showed up but I knew he had a job to do so I had to be okay. Gemma, Anne and Grace were taking it in turns to keep me company – more like babysit me – because Liz had become concerned about my blood pressure being high and telling me that I should be resting as much as possible. Resting was not easy for me.

[[MORE]]

“The same as the last time you asked.” I said to her as I folded the warm freshly washed pink onesie I had on top of my bump.

Gemma frowned at me as she continued with her own pile of freshly washed baby clothes while an episode of ‘friends’ played in the background. She was good company, I was as close to her as I was to Grace, but I was getting sick and tired of being asked if I was okay. If I wasn’t okay, then Nora wasn’t, so the second I felt something was wrong I would let her know.

All I felt was… odd. Luke showed up weeks ago, threatened to involve himself back into my life, into Nora’s life but he hadn’t since uttered a peep. Now he knew that I was pregnant and I still hadn’t managed to receive even one text to ask if I was okay; if Nora was okay. Harry had told me not to worry so much if he was gone then so be it. Maybe Luke had dropped the idea and the less he interreacted the better it would be if he were to want custody, but I still couldn’t fight away the little niggle of worry at the back of my head that he was going to come back and come back hard.

“Hey, we all just want you and Nora to be okay.” She leant over and snatched half of my pile of onesies and just shrugged her shoulders when I shot her a glare.

“I know you do.” I said folding the last onesie I had in my pile. “It just stresses me out more when people keep asking. I won’t hesitate to say if something doesn’t feel right so you don’t need to ask every five minutes.”

Gemma sighed and nodded her head very reluctantly. We sat in silence with only the sound of the television filling the room for a few minutes until we were interrupted by a knock on the front door. My brows furrowed in confusion as I glanced over to Gemma. I lived in a gated community so it wasn’t often I had someone knocking on my door without receiving a text to from them first.

Gemma shrugged her shoulders and I pushed up onto my feet, she tried to get me to stop and sit back down but I just waved my hand at her. With a roll of her eyes she got up and followed my soft steps to the door. It could have been Anne and she had just forgotten her key to get in but that bad feeling a had felt before was back and was churning big storm waves in my stomach.

“Evangeline Jones,” The young boy in the suit asked the second I pulled the door open. It fit him poorly and he seemed a little nervous to ask, his eyes flickering down to my bump that was stretching against the material of my tee shirt.

“Yes,” I said nervously, my hand already shaking at my side as I eyed the envelope he had in his hand.

I knew he was a lawyer, or a lawyer’s intern, without him having to tell me. I had dealt with many self-righteous assholes in suits for one lifetime to know without question that’s what this man was.

“You’ve been served.” I swallowed heavily, already knowing that’s what he was here for as he held out the folder papers to me.

“By who?” Gemma snapped at the young boy and he recoiled backwards a little at the tone of her voice. She stepped up beside me eyes burning holes into the grey suit as I slowly pulled the envelope from the lawyer boy’s fingers.

Nervously he looked between Gemma and I before looking down at me. “Luke Williams.”

Gemma swore under her breath before slamming the door in the lawyer boy’s face. Slowly I stepped back from the door my hands struggling to pull the staple keeping the folds of the paper together my hands were shaking that badly. My chest was tight and I felt ready to burst into tears. I knew this would come but I didn’t think it would hurt this much.

“Evie, sit down.” Gemma gripped my arm tightly trying to pull me back to the couch.

Shaking my head, I shrugged my arm back out of her hold. “I need to know what he wants.”

My fingers were still struggling with the stupid staple that was holding the papers together, my fingernail found grip under the little metal strip and I ripped it not caring if I tore the paper in the process. I felt sick as I unfolded the pages with unsteady hands.

“He wants custody.” I whispered as my eyes quickly read over the words. “He fucking avoids me for a month then sues me for custody. I would have talked through this with him but he sues me.”

“Breathe Evie,” Gemma stepped forward again her hands gently wrapping around my upper arms, traveling them over my hands slowly to soothe me. “Breathe and I’ll call Harry.”

Shaking my head, I tried to take in a deep breathes, to copy her deep breathes, but there was a tightness in my throat that stopped me from getting any air in. “He’s on stage.” I chocked.

My fingers were numb and my eyes were blurring. I felt wrong, so, so wrong, my feet felt like jelly and my mind told me that I just shouldn’t be standing anymore. Attempting to take in one more breathe I clenched my eyes tightly, the dim lights of the front entry stinging my eyes.

“Gem,” I groaned. “You know how I said if I felt something was wrong I’d tell you… somethings wrong.”

My legs gave out and I felt Gemma grab me tightly to help keep me up. I heard her call my name once in fear before I was enveloped in darkness.

.-.-.-.

Harry:

There was a drop of sweat slipping down my temple as I ran down the steps and backstage the sounds of thousands of fans still screaming following me. My heart was still pounding a tattoo against my chest, like it always was after the high of performing on stage and doing one of the things I loved most.

As grateful and happy as I was to be doing what I loved, performing to thousands of fans never seemed to distract me from my thoughts on Evie who was thousands upon thousands of miles away from me.

For years she had been my best friend and she was always the first person I turned to for anything. Whenever I was worried, she was the one I wanted to talk, when I was upset, it was her that I always called, even when I was happy or something good happened she was the first that I wanted to tell. She was always the first to call me. And all of that made it harder to leave her behind when I went on tour.

As good as this high was it just didn’t feel the same as when she wasn’t here to enjoy it with. She was his as well now. I’d finally made her my girlfriend, it might have taken a pregnancy to gain the guts to do so but I had her and had never felt more in love with anyone. His life was perfect. I also had a little baby girl to think about, despite the possibility of Nora not being mine, she wouldn’t be loved or spoilt any less.

It gutted me to leave them behind but I knew that it was better that they were safe at home. The first leg of the tour was too much for Evie, the extra travel wouldn’t have been good for her and with Luke taunting her and coming back into her life when her blood pressure was already questionable, being so far away from home really wasn’t an option for her right now.

“Harry,” Jeff ran up to me a worried look set deep in his eyes as he quickly navigated his was through the backstage crew.

“Not now Jeff, I just want to get back to the hotel and call Evie.” Quickly shrugging back out of my suit jacket I ran towards the dressing room to get changed so I could get back to the hotel as quickly as possible and check up on Evie.

“Gemma called about twenty minutes ago. She collapsed and they took her to hospital.” Jeff said a little out of breath as he tried to keep up with my hurried pace.

I stopped in my tracks, my feet feeling heavy with Jeff’s words. My chest was tight and it felt like I couldn’t breathe. Evie’s blood pressure had been high but not dangerously high enough that it would land her in hospital. She was fine at her appointment a few days ago what had happened between then and now.

“Did she say what happened?” I asked, sound trying to come up my throat but catching a bit. Reaching up a hand I pulled at the buttons of my shirt to air out my heated chest. It felt ten times hotter now then what it did before. “Is Evie okay?” I added quickly.

All of the crew were looking at me with fast worried glances now and so were the band as the joined us in the hallway. I must have looked like a nervous wreck to get such anxious looks from Sarah and Clare. Even Mitch looked like he wanted to come over and check that I was okay.

“I don’t know, she called me from the ambulance and said she was still unconscious. She didn’t say what happened either, she just wanted to talk to you.” He swallowed, eyes trying very hard to avoid mine.

Jeff had my phone in his hand and I quickly grabbed it, finding Gemma’s number and dialling it only a few seconds later.

“Harry, she said she’d call if anything changed for the worse.” Jeff yelled after me but I was to concentrated on the dial tone.

I was already stressed hearing about Evie and I didn’t want to listen to him or anyone unless it was Gemma, or Evie herself telling me that she was okay. The only thing that could truly calm me now is hearing Evie’s soft voice through the phone.

Jeff hadn’t been the most supportive finding out that I could have gotten Evie pregnant so I didn’t trust how much he truly cared right now. Jeff didn’t hate Evie, he liked her more than any other girl I had been with, he loved her, but he was more worried about what it would my career if Nora was mine. It didn’t matter either way if she was mine or not because I wasn’t going to leave her or Evie. I loved my two girls more than anything.  

“It’s my fucking girlfriend and daughter and I’m not going to wait around to find it if they’re okay or not.” My voice was rough and loud, my words bouncing of the walls of the hallway.

Most of the crew turned away after my outburst hurriedly got back to there job, fumbling a little with there haste. Clare, Sarah and Adam though stood there looking a little surprised by the declaration but Mitch just gave a knowing smile as if he had known all along what was going on between Evie and I behind closed hotel doors.

I hadn’t confirmed my relationship with Evie to anyone but I also wasn’t keeping it hidden or denying it to anybody that asked. Most of them had become suspicious to it but never actually asked the question. I wasn’t sure if they picked up on the daughter comment or not because only Jeff knew that current detail.

“I know that’s why I’ve booked you a flight to London.” He started softly, exhaling heavily, “It leaves in an hour so you need to leave now. You can have a day and a half with her if it isn’t to bad and if it is call me and I’ll see if I can rearrange some dates so you can spend more time with her.” He paused for a second before meeting my eyes. “If it was Glenne I would want to be with her.”

The phone rang out against my ear and I heard Gemma’s message tone. Jeff was looking at me sympathetically and I didn’t hate it. I breathed out deeply and raised my hand to rub at my eyes. Jeff was one of my best friends behind Evie so despite his dislike towards the situation we were in he was going to support me through it.

“Thanks,” I whispered as I dialled Gemma’s number again. I wasn’t going to stop ringing until I could talk to her.

“Yeah, just go and make sure that they’re okay.” Jeff said with a strained smile and a wave of his hand to shake me off.

“Make sure they’re okay Harry.” Clare said nervously, her hands pressed worriedly to her lips.

Nodding my head at her I turned away from them, running towards the waiting car with my security only a few steps behind me. I still had my suit on but it was the last thing that I was thinking off. All I wanted to do was get to Evie and check that her and Nora were okay.

.-.-.-.

Evie:

Shifting in the hospital bed the rough sheets rustled and scratched against my skin. I only managed to move a little until the IV drip in my arm caught and I winced as I was tugged backwards. They wanted me to relax but they put me in an uncomfortable bed and stuck a needle in my arm. My bed and Harry were what I really wanted but I literally got stuck with a needle.

“Evie,” A deep voice echoed from my side. A small smile pulled at my lips at the sound of the voice and I snuggled further into the uncomfortable bed at the sound of Harry’s voice. I was probably imagining it but it would help to relax me. “Evie,” the voice repeated with a small chuckle.

Slowly I blinked my eyes open to see a very tired, a very real looking Harry leaning his weight on the bed at my side. It was in that moment I noticed the warmth of his large hand engulfing mine. He was still wearing the black button up of some Gucci suit I had seen him wearing on stage before all of this happened. It felt like I had only just seen him in it but I had been in out since I collapsed at the house so I don’t know how long ago since he had been prancing around on stage. I didn’t even know if he was really here or if he was just a product of the medication they had put me on to relax.

“Harry?” I asked my voice scratching up my throat from the misuse.

“Hey Eve’s.” Harry’s jaw tensed as he pulled my hand closer to his lips, gently peppering small kisses over my cold knuckles. There was water in his eyes as he smiled sadly and he gripped my hand tightly as if it was a life line and he was holding into me with all that he had.

“You should be in Brazil mister,” Lifting my finger from his tight hold I stroked it over his cheek that was covered in a little stubble.

He chuckled humourlessly and moved his fingers so he could grab my lone one still caressing his cheek and pull it back into his strong grasp. As glad as I was to have him here the biggest disagreement we constantly got into was about his career. This maybe was something we could put under a very different light. If he ended up in hospital I would have been on a plane to him the exact second I could have and not a moment later.

“Had to check that you and Nora were okay.” He sounded heartbroken, voice cracking over the few words.

“We’re fine.” Pulling our joined hands down I rested them over my chest, savouring the comfort the touch bought. My lips brushed over his knuckles quickly and his eyes fluttered closed and he exhaled out heavily.

Harry opened his eyes back up and I caught the soft green colour before they flickered with something I couldn’t quite pinpoint but it wasn’t pleased. “Your blood pressure sky rocketed. You’re lucky that Liz said you’re not preeclamptic. You could have had a stroke, gone into labour early or you could have died if it got any higher.”

Harry’s jaw tensed and he turned away from me as a tear slipped down his cheek. I had already got a run down from Liz earlier though I was still sought of out of it from a sedative they had given me. The stress and anxiety I got from getting the papers from Luke’s lawyers caused my blood pressure to get dangerously high, which was why I fainted and being seven months pregnant it could cause a number of complications for both me and Nora.

I didn’t even want to begin to imagine how scared he must have felt finding out what happened and being so far away. But I was okay. Nora was okay.

“I know, but we’re okay now.” Reaching up I slipped my hand back around his jaw and pulled him down so he was looking back at me again. “Just a little dehydrated.” Lifting my arm, I showed him the IV drip and he smiled with a light shake of his head his eyes still showing how he was working through all of this.

“I love you,” he breathed leaning down to press a soft kiss to my lips. Mine were chapped and contrasted majorly to the salty tear stained soft caress of his.

My hand cupped his cheek to hold him closer to me as I tried to kiss him a little deeper but I still felt the smallest hint of the sedative lingering in my veins so my lips were a little sloppier than normal, my hands trying to hold on tightly but came across weakly. Harry laughed, pulling back from me but kept close, lips pressing small chaste kisses around my face. I had really missed him.

“You’ve got to be fucking kidding me.” I jolted at the new voice in the room that came from behind Harry’s quickly tensing body.

Luke sure had a knack for making the most perfectly timed entrances.

My breath felt stuck in my throat and the airy calmness I got from the sedative was ripped from me with Luke’s entrance. My eyes stayed locked on Harry as he rolled his and tensed above me, his lips setting into a tight annoyed line. I gripped a little tighter to Harry’s cheeks, not wanting him to pull back. My heart was hammering against my chest painfully and if Harry put his hand over it he would feel every worried beat.

Instead Harry wrapped his hands around my wrists, fingers softly caressing the insides where he could feel my pulse. He tugged my hands back away from his face even as I shook my head hurriedly. He slipped his hand into mine, squeezing it in reassurance as he turned to look at Luke angrily stood in the doorway, he stood in a way that blocked me from Luke’s view and I had to watch the muscles in his back flex.

“You have to be fucking kidding me Luke.” Harry said equally as annoyed as what Luke was. “She’s here because of you. You couldn’t have talked to her like a normal person and not freak her out?”

“This has nothing to do with you Harry. I should have known that you’d get straight into bed with her though. You always wanted her. You’ve been waiting for us to blow up so you could swing in and save the day” I swallowed hard with Luke’s words, this wasn’t something I wanted to be dealing with now. My heart rate monitor beeping fast was just making me even more anxious.

“Get out Luke. She’s supposed to be resting which you are not helping.” Harry gripped my hand tightly as he turned to look back at the monitor where the screen was flashing red. I tried to take in some deep breathes but it wasn’t helping a single bit.

“Luke please just go.” I whimpered as I shifted. I felt uncomfortable. I wanted to grab the drip and rip it out of my arm even though it would hurt to pull it out it would be much better than having it in. The clip on my finger could go with it.

Looking around Harry I watched Luke shake his head and come further into my hospital room. He tired to glance around Harry to see my but Harry stepped into his line of sight every time. “She’s carrying my baby. I have every right to be here.”

Harry looked down at me, a questioning gleam in his eyes. I still hadn’t told Luke about what had happened between Harry and I after the break up. I hadn’t really had the chance to say anything, since this was only the second time that I had seen him since the breakup and it wasn’t a conversation we had over text.

Swallowing deeply, I looked away from Harry, I felt small under his look, from the corner of my eye I saw him purse his lips and turn his look towards Luke. “It’s her body and she doesn’t want you here.” Harry said tightly and his grip around my hand matched the one of his voice.

“It’s still my baby, I have rights.”

Watching through squinted eyes I saw Luke step forward again and the warmth of Harry’s hand slipped from around mine as he moved to block Luke from getting to close to me. The heart rate monitor was still beeping rapidly, so quickly I thought it might explode. Curling up on the bed I wrapped my arms around my belly, my protective instincts kicking in. Where were the nurses?

“Luke,” I yelled as I watch his hands came up to Harry’s chest, his tanned fingers wrapping around the soft material of the button up. Harry quickly pushed them back out of the way and stepped to block me more.

“Just because you’re fucking her doesn’t make you my baby’s father.”

Harry’s entire body froze with Luke’s comment and I saw that he was struggling to not react to what he said. Normally I could read Harry so easily but looking at him from the side now I couldn’t tell what part of Luke’s sentence upset him more. The vulgar comment about us having sex or the insult that Nora wasn’t his.

I wanted to reach out and grab him. I wanted to hug him and hold him close while I whispered in his ear that I loved him and so did Nora. With how much she reacted to Harry’s voice I had no doubt she would be Harry’s girl despite who her dad was on paper.

A small scream leaves my mouth and I quickly move my hand up to cover the sound. The room that had been peaceful and quite only moments ago was now a loud mess. Luke had shoved Harry backwards causing him to knock back into the bed, jostling me sharply with the movement. Nurses and security rushed into the room at the commotion and Harry was trying to keep his hands out of the fight. Harry’s little reaction to the situation didn’t stop Luke and he threw himself at Harry and as he did his fingers caught around the drip, yanking it from my arm as he and Harry went tumbling to the hard ground.

I cried out at the stinging feeling which caused both Luke and Harry to freeze on the floor. The pushed at each other as they fought to get their feet, eyes sliding over to me as they forgot about each other. Both of them moved to comfort me but Harry moved a second faster, speedily grabbing a bit of gauze, pressing it tightly over the inside of me elbow where the needle just was and it had started to bleed with how roughly it was removed.

Security had come in at some point, dragging Luke back out of the room as he profusely apologised to me, while also trying to get security to let him go but they weren’t having it and moments later it was just Harry at my side again along with a young nurse.

“No,” I whimpered, a steady stream of tears sliding down my cheeks as another security guard wrapped his hand around Harry’s arm and started to pull him from the room as well.

“No, not him.” The nurse said as she pushed a small hand against the security’s chest to get him to let go of Harry.

The security guard nodded at her after a short second, he gave Harry a look up and down, checking he was doing anything wrong before finally leaving the room. I only half registered that Luke was still yelling from outside the room because Harry’s hand pressed down hard on my arm to stop the blood.

“Breathe Evie,” He said out of breath, fingers massaging soft circles into my elbow.

My heart was thrashing against my chest, my breathing was tight and everything hurt. What the fuck was that.

The nurse knocked Harry out of her way gently as she took my arm from him, moving so she had her own hand over the gauze. I watched her as she whispered something into Harry ear, he nodded in reply to what she said eyes still locked on me.

Harry shifted himself up onto the bed, his hip pressing into mine as he reached over my quivering body to take my hand into his own shaking one. With his other hand he cupped my cheek, thumb swiping over my cheekbone forcing me eyes to stay on him instead of drift over to where the nurse was getting ready to put the IV back in.

“Look at me Evie bear.” He whispered, his breathes slow, structured and deep trying to get me to mimic them but it wasn’t working. It felt like there was a binding around my neck, stopping any air getting in. My anxiety had me in choke hold that wasn’t anywhere close to loosening its reigns. “Tell me about the time you broke your arm.”

“What?” I questioned a little confused to where he was going. My eyes flickered around the room wondering if he was being serious and the trauma of what happened hadn’t sent me off my rocker.

“Grace took you to that party, remember?” His hand soothed through my hair that was resting on the flat pillow. The touch was soft but wasn’t enough to stop this crippling anxiety attack.

“She didn’t tell dad.” I said my mind being drawn back to one of the most prominent memories I had of my father. “She lied and said she would take me to see the new Harry Potter because he wouldn’t let her go a party and then one of her friends knocked me down the porch steps and I landed on my arm.”

I smiled a little, a twitch of my lips at most as I leant into Harry’s touch on my cheek. I’d only told him this story once, ages ago when I first met him, I couldn’t believe that he remembered it. Not only remember it but remember how much the memory meant to me.

“Please don’t tell dad.” Grace begged as we rounded the last corner only a few houses from our own.

 

I frowned looking down at my arm that I kept cradled close to my chest. My tears had long since dried up but there was still a stinging pain and an engulfing heat coursing through my entire arm. It was nowhere near my heart but I swore I felt the beat of it around my elbow. I knew it was broken, it had to be there was no way that it could possibly hurt this much without being broken.

 

“I think he’s going to notice.”

 

Dad was like a bomb dog. He sniffed out when Grace and I were up to something the second we thought about it. It was a surprise that she got this far tonight without him figuring out what she had planned.

 

I was right as soon as we walked through the door we saw dad, just shy of steam coming out of his ears, angry as he wore a path into mum’s favourite rug in the living area. His gaze landed on Grace first eyes flaming, mouth open ready to yell before he flicked his heated gaze to me and on my arm. All the anger disappeared from his eyes in that second.

 

“Grace, go to bed.” He said sternly, eyes going back to Grace.

 

Grace rolled her eyes but did as he said, drunkenly stumbling as she made her way to the stairs and dad swore under his breath as he watched her. Once Grace had made it half way up the stairs dad rushed over to me taking my arm softly in his hands and shushing me gently when I whimpered.

 

“What happened Evie bear?”

 

“Ashley was drunk and knocked me down the stairs.”

 

Dad frowned, not saying anything back as he helped me out of my jacket. Once my jacket was pulled off I saw the full extent and dad swore again. It was bright red and swollen and I cried out as dad poked it tenderly with his fingers.

 

“Okay, sweetheart I think we need to go to the hospital.” He grabbed my jacket from where he sat it down and draped it back over my shoulders, quickly going in search of his car keys.

 

“I’m so sorry,” I cried grabbing my wrist again to keep my arm safely against my chest.

 

“It’s not your fault Evie bear.” He came over to me, arm looping around my shoulders to pull me into a loose hug so he wouldn’t hurt my arm any more. He leaned down so he was height was better matched to mine. Gently he peppered some soft kisses to my forehead that made my tears stop right then and there. “Let’s get you to the hospital and get you all better.”

I chocked on a small sob as I clenched my eyes shut. It was five years ago but it could have been yesterday with how prominent the memory was. I could still feel the soft kiss against the side of my head and it helped to relax me. I felt Harry move beside me so he was on the bed and then his lips gently pressed to my temple and I smiled softly.

“Feel better?” He asked and slowly I opened my eyes back up to him.

Taking in a deep steady breathe I chuckled a little. I felt so much better. Still a little worked up and emotional but I could breathe and the heart rate monitor had stopped it’s incessant beeping. Harry was smiling as he moved a hand to rub it over my belly.

“How did you know that would calm me down?”

Harry shrugged, fingers locking with mine as I put them over his. “Know how much you loved your parents and I wanted you to concentrate on something else, something good and that made you happy.”

I chuckled cuddling into as side the best I could with the new drip and the restrictions of the hospital bed. “That hurt a lot but he was so soft and caring. Cried at the hospital and everything.” I slowed taking in a steadying breathe before I continued. “I love you Harry. Thank you for coming.”

.-.-.-..

So sorry this took forever to come, I haven’t been motivated at all to edit it this so blame depression, shes a bitch. Next chapter, I am rewriting so it might take a little longer to post, but chapter 9 is almost finished and chapter 10 just needs an update. We’re in the home stretch now, tell me what you think.
trail.content:
Month Seven: Twenty Nine Weeks

With thanks to:

Beta writer @whoopsharrystyles / Pregnancy Stuff @geenalovesthelittlethings / and for listening to me for months @all-the-love-harold

masterpost / Update TBA

M+ RATING // Language and sexual references

.-.-.-.

“Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.” ― Martin Luther King Jr., A Testament of Hope: The Essential Writings and Speeches

“Are you okay?” Gemma asked me for what felt like the millionth time this morning.

Harry had been gone for a few weeks now while he did the South American leg of the tour. I was scared and a little nerve wracked on being without him after Luke showed up but I knew he had a job to do so I had to be okay. Gemma, Anne and Grace were taking it in turns to keep me company – more like babysit me – because Liz had become concerned about my blood pressure being high and telling me that I should be resting as much as possible. Resting was not easy for me.

“The same as the last time you asked.” I said to her as I folded the warm freshly washed pink onesie I had on top of my bump.

Gemma frowned at me as she continued with her own pile of freshly washed baby clothes while an episode of ‘friends’ played in the background. She was good company, I was as close to her as I was to Grace, but I was getting sick and tired of being asked if I was okay. If I wasn’t okay, then Nora wasn’t, so the second I felt something was wrong I would let her know.

All I felt was… odd. Luke showed up weeks ago, threatened to involve himself back into my life, into Nora’s life but he hadn’t since uttered a peep. Now he knew that I was pregnant and I still hadn’t managed to receive even one text to ask if I was okay; if Nora was okay. Harry had told me not to worry so much if he was gone then so be it. Maybe Luke had dropped the idea and the less he interreacted the better it would be if he were to want custody, but I still couldn’t fight away the little niggle of worry at the back of my head that he was going to come back and come back hard.

“Hey, we all just want you and Nora to be okay.” She leant over and snatched half of my pile of onesies and just shrugged her shoulders when I shot her a glare.

“I know you do.” I said folding the last onesie I had in my pile. “It just stresses me out more when people keep asking. I won’t hesitate to say if something doesn’t feel right so you don’t need to ask every five minutes.”

Gemma sighed and nodded her head very reluctantly. We sat in silence with only the sound of the television filling the room for a few minutes until we were interrupted by a knock on the front door. My brows furrowed in confusion as I glanced over to Gemma. I lived in a gated community so it wasn’t often I had someone knocking on my door without receiving a text to from them first.

Gemma shrugged her shoulders and I pushed up onto my feet, she tried to get me to stop and sit back down but I just waved my hand at her. With a roll of her eyes she got up and followed my soft steps to the door. It could have been Anne and she had just forgotten her key to get in but that bad feeling a had felt before was back and was churning big storm waves in my stomach.

“Evangeline Jones,” The young boy in the suit asked the second I pulled the door open. It fit him poorly and he seemed a little nervous to ask, his eyes flickering down to my bump that was stretching against the material of my tee shirt.

“Yes,” I said nervously, my hand already shaking at my side as I eyed the envelope he had in his hand.

I knew he was a lawyer, or a lawyer’s intern, without him having to tell me. I had dealt with many self-righteous assholes in suits for one lifetime to know without question that’s what this man was.

“You’ve been served.” I swallowed heavily, already knowing that’s what he was here for as he held out the folder papers to me.

“By who?” Gemma snapped at the young boy and he recoiled backwards a little at the tone of her voice. She stepped up beside me eyes burning holes into the grey suit as I slowly pulled the envelope from the lawyer boy’s fingers.

Nervously he looked between Gemma and I before looking down at me. “Luke Williams.”

Gemma swore under her breath before slamming the door in the lawyer boy’s face. Slowly I stepped back from the door my hands struggling to pull the staple keeping the folds of the paper together my hands were shaking that badly. My chest was tight and I felt ready to burst into tears. I knew this would come but I didn’t think it would hurt this much.

“Evie, sit down.” Gemma gripped my arm tightly trying to pull me back to the couch.

Shaking my head, I shrugged my arm back out of her hold. “I need to know what he wants.”

My fingers were still struggling with the stupid staple that was holding the papers together, my fingernail found grip under the little metal strip and I ripped it not caring if I tore the paper in the process. I felt sick as I unfolded the pages with unsteady hands.

“He wants custody.” I whispered as my eyes quickly read over the words. “He fucking avoids me for a month then sues me for custody. I would have talked through this with him but he sues me.”

“Breathe Evie,” Gemma stepped forward again her hands gently wrapping around my upper arms, traveling them over my hands slowly to soothe me. “Breathe and I’ll call Harry.”

Shaking my head, I tried to take in a deep breathes, to copy her deep breathes, but there was a tightness in my throat that stopped me from getting any air in. “He’s on stage.” I chocked.

My fingers were numb and my eyes were blurring. I felt wrong, so, so wrong, my feet felt like jelly and my mind told me that I just shouldn’t be standing anymore. Attempting to take in one more breathe I clenched my eyes tightly, the dim lights of the front entry stinging my eyes.

“Gem,” I groaned. “You know how I said if I felt something was wrong I’d tell you… somethings wrong.”

My legs gave out and I felt Gemma grab me tightly to help keep me up. I heard her call my name once in fear before I was enveloped in darkness.

.-.-.-.

Harry:

There was a drop of sweat slipping down my temple as I ran down the steps and backstage the sounds of thousands of fans still screaming following me. My heart was still pounding a tattoo against my chest, like it always was after the high of performing on stage and doing one of the things I loved most.

As grateful and happy as I was to be doing what I loved, performing to thousands of fans never seemed to distract me from my thoughts on Evie who was thousands upon thousands of miles away from me.

For years she had been my best friend and she was always the first person I turned to for anything. Whenever I was worried, she was the one I wanted to talk, when I was upset, it was her that I always called, even when I was happy or something good happened she was the first that I wanted to tell. She was always the first to call me. And all of that made it harder to leave her behind when I went on tour.

As good as this high was it just didn’t feel the same as when she wasn’t here to enjoy it with. She was his as well now. I’d finally made her my girlfriend, it might have taken a pregnancy to gain the guts to do so but I had her and had never felt more in love with anyone. His life was perfect. I also had a little baby girl to think about, despite the possibility of Nora not being mine, she wouldn’t be loved or spoilt any less.

It gutted me to leave them behind but I knew that it was better that they were safe at home. The first leg of the tour was too much for Evie, the extra travel wouldn’t have been good for her and with Luke taunting her and coming back into her life when her blood pressure was already questionable, being so far away from home really wasn’t an option for her right now.

“Harry,” Jeff ran up to me a worried look set deep in his eyes as he quickly navigated his was through the backstage crew.

“Not now Jeff, I just want to get back to the hotel and call Evie.” Quickly shrugging back out of my suit jacket I ran towards the dressing room to get changed so I could get back to the hotel as quickly as possible and check up on Evie.

“Gemma called about twenty minutes ago. She collapsed and they took her to hospital.” Jeff said a little out of breath as he tried to keep up with my hurried pace.

I stopped in my tracks, my feet feeling heavy with Jeff’s words. My chest was tight and it felt like I couldn’t breathe. Evie’s blood pressure had been high but not dangerously high enough that it would land her in hospital. She was fine at her appointment a few days ago what had happened between then and now.

“Did she say what happened?” I asked, sound trying to come up my throat but catching a bit. Reaching up a hand I pulled at the buttons of my shirt to air out my heated chest. It felt ten times hotter now then what it did before. “Is Evie okay?” I added quickly.

All of the crew were looking at me with fast worried glances now and so were the band as the joined us in the hallway. I must have looked like a nervous wreck to get such anxious looks from Sarah and Clare. Even Mitch looked like he wanted to come over and check that I was okay.

“I don’t know, she called me from the ambulance and said she was still unconscious. She didn’t say what happened either, she just wanted to talk to you.” He swallowed, eyes trying very hard to avoid mine.

Jeff had my phone in his hand and I quickly grabbed it, finding Gemma’s number and dialling it only a few seconds later.

“Harry, she said she’d call if anything changed for the worse.” Jeff yelled after me but I was to concentrated on the dial tone.

I was already stressed hearing about Evie and I didn’t want to listen to him or anyone unless it was Gemma, or Evie herself telling me that she was okay. The only thing that could truly calm me now is hearing Evie’s soft voice through the phone.

Jeff hadn’t been the most supportive finding out that I could have gotten Evie pregnant so I didn’t trust how much he truly cared right now. Jeff didn’t hate Evie, he liked her more than any other girl I had been with, he loved her, but he was more worried about what it would my career if Nora was mine. It didn’t matter either way if she was mine or not because I wasn’t going to leave her or Evie. I loved my two girls more than anything.  

“It’s my fucking girlfriend and daughter and I’m not going to wait around to find it if they’re okay or not.” My voice was rough and loud, my words bouncing of the walls of the hallway.

Most of the crew turned away after my outburst hurriedly got back to there job, fumbling a little with there haste. Clare, Sarah and Adam though stood there looking a little surprised by the declaration but Mitch just gave a knowing smile as if he had known all along what was going on between Evie and I behind closed hotel doors.

I hadn’t confirmed my relationship with Evie to anyone but I also wasn’t keeping it hidden or denying it to anybody that asked. Most of them had become suspicious to it but never actually asked the question. I wasn’t sure if they picked up on the daughter comment or not because only Jeff knew that current detail.

“I know that’s why I’ve booked you a flight to London.” He started softly, exhaling heavily, “It leaves in an hour so you need to leave now. You can have a day and a half with her if it isn’t to bad and if it is call me and I’ll see if I can rearrange some dates so you can spend more time with her.” He paused for a second before meeting my eyes. “If it was Glenne I would want to be with her.”

The phone rang out against my ear and I heard Gemma’s message tone. Jeff was looking at me sympathetically and I didn’t hate it. I breathed out deeply and raised my hand to rub at my eyes. Jeff was one of my best friends behind Evie so despite his dislike towards the situation we were in he was going to support me through it.

“Thanks,” I whispered as I dialled Gemma’s number again. I wasn’t going to stop ringing until I could talk to her.

“Yeah, just go and make sure that they’re okay.” Jeff said with a strained smile and a wave of his hand to shake me off.

“Make sure they’re okay Harry.” Clare said nervously, her hands pressed worriedly to her lips.

Nodding my head at her I turned away from them, running towards the waiting car with my security only a few steps behind me. I still had my suit on but it was the last thing that I was thinking off. All I wanted to do was get to Evie and check that her and Nora were okay.

.-.-.-.

Evie:

Shifting in the hospital bed the rough sheets rustled and scratched against my skin. I only managed to move a little until the IV drip in my arm caught and I winced as I was tugged backwards. They wanted me to relax but they put me in an uncomfortable bed and stuck a needle in my arm. My bed and Harry were what I really wanted but I literally got stuck with a needle.

“Evie,” A deep voice echoed from my side. A small smile pulled at my lips at the sound of the voice and I snuggled further into the uncomfortable bed at the sound of Harry’s voice. I was probably imagining it but it would help to relax me. “Evie,” the voice repeated with a small chuckle.

Slowly I blinked my eyes open to see a very tired, a very real looking Harry leaning his weight on the bed at my side. It was in that moment I noticed the warmth of his large hand engulfing mine. He was still wearing the black button up of some Gucci suit I had seen him wearing on stage before all of this happened. It felt like I had only just seen him in it but I had been in out since I collapsed at the house so I don’t know how long ago since he had been prancing around on stage. I didn’t even know if he was really here or if he was just a product of the medication they had put me on to relax.

“Harry?” I asked my voice scratching up my throat from the misuse.

“Hey Eve’s.” Harry’s jaw tensed as he pulled my hand closer to his lips, gently peppering small kisses over my cold knuckles. There was water in his eyes as he smiled sadly and he gripped my hand tightly as if it was a life line and he was holding into me with all that he had.

“You should be in Brazil mister,” Lifting my finger from his tight hold I stroked it over his cheek that was covered in a little stubble.

He chuckled humourlessly and moved his fingers so he could grab my lone one still caressing his cheek and pull it back into his strong grasp. As glad as I was to have him here the biggest disagreement we constantly got into was about his career. This maybe was something we could put under a very different light. If he ended up in hospital I would have been on a plane to him the exact second I could have and not a moment later.

“Had to check that you and Nora were okay.” He sounded heartbroken, voice cracking over the few words.

“We’re fine.” Pulling our joined hands down I rested them over my chest, savouring the comfort the touch bought. My lips brushed over his knuckles quickly and his eyes fluttered closed and he exhaled out heavily.

Harry opened his eyes back up and I caught the soft green colour before they flickered with something I couldn’t quite pinpoint but it wasn’t pleased. “Your blood pressure sky rocketed. You’re lucky that Liz said you’re not preeclamptic. You could have had a stroke, gone into labour early or you could have died if it got any higher.”

Harry’s jaw tensed and he turned away from me as a tear slipped down his cheek. I had already got a run down from Liz earlier though I was still sought of out of it from a sedative they had given me. The stress and anxiety I got from getting the papers from Luke’s lawyers caused my blood pressure to get dangerously high, which was why I fainted and being seven months pregnant it could cause a number of complications for both me and Nora.

I didn’t even want to begin to imagine how scared he must have felt finding out what happened and being so far away. But I was okay. Nora was okay.

“I know, but we’re okay now.” Reaching up I slipped my hand back around his jaw and pulled him down so he was looking back at me again. “Just a little dehydrated.” Lifting my arm, I showed him the IV drip and he smiled with a light shake of his head his eyes still showing how he was working through all of this.

“I love you,” he breathed leaning down to press a soft kiss to my lips. Mine were chapped and contrasted majorly to the salty tear stained soft caress of his.

My hand cupped his cheek to hold him closer to me as I tried to kiss him a little deeper but I still felt the smallest hint of the sedative lingering in my veins so my lips were a little sloppier than normal, my hands trying to hold on tightly but came across weakly. Harry laughed, pulling back from me but kept close, lips pressing small chaste kisses around my face. I had really missed him.

“You’ve got to be fucking kidding me.” I jolted at the new voice in the room that came from behind Harry’s quickly tensing body.

Luke sure had a knack for making the most perfectly timed entrances.

My breath felt stuck in my throat and the airy calmness I got from the sedative was ripped from me with Luke’s entrance. My eyes stayed locked on Harry as he rolled his and tensed above me, his lips setting into a tight annoyed line. I gripped a little tighter to Harry’s cheeks, not wanting him to pull back. My heart was hammering against my chest painfully and if Harry put his hand over it he would feel every worried beat.

Instead Harry wrapped his hands around my wrists, fingers softly caressing the insides where he could feel my pulse. He tugged my hands back away from his face even as I shook my head hurriedly. He slipped his hand into mine, squeezing it in reassurance as he turned to look at Luke angrily stood in the doorway, he stood in a way that blocked me from Luke’s view and I had to watch the muscles in his back flex.

“You have to be fucking kidding me Luke.” Harry said equally as annoyed as what Luke was. “She’s here because of you. You couldn’t have talked to her like a normal person and not freak her out?”

“This has nothing to do with you Harry. I should have known that you’d get straight into bed with her though. You always wanted her. You’ve been waiting for us to blow up so you could swing in and save the day” I swallowed hard with Luke’s words, this wasn’t something I wanted to be dealing with now. My heart rate monitor beeping fast was just making me even more anxious.

“Get out Luke. She’s supposed to be resting which you are not helping.” Harry gripped my hand tightly as he turned to look back at the monitor where the screen was flashing red. I tried to take in some deep breathes but it wasn’t helping a single bit.

“Luke please just go.” I whimpered as I shifted. I felt uncomfortable. I wanted to grab the drip and rip it out of my arm even though it would hurt to pull it out it would be much better than having it in. The clip on my finger could go with it.

Looking around Harry I watched Luke shake his head and come further into my hospital room. He tired to glance around Harry to see my but Harry stepped into his line of sight every time. “She’s carrying my baby. I have every right to be here.”

Harry looked down at me, a questioning gleam in his eyes. I still hadn’t told Luke about what had happened between Harry and I after the break up. I hadn’t really had the chance to say anything, since this was only the second time that I had seen him since the breakup and it wasn’t a conversation we had over text.

Swallowing deeply, I looked away from Harry, I felt small under his look, from the corner of my eye I saw him purse his lips and turn his look towards Luke. “It’s her body and she doesn’t want you here.” Harry said tightly and his grip around my hand matched the one of his voice.

“It’s still my baby, I have rights.”

Watching through squinted eyes I saw Luke step forward again and the warmth of Harry’s hand slipped from around mine as he moved to block Luke from getting to close to me. The heart rate monitor was still beeping rapidly, so quickly I thought it might explode. Curling up on the bed I wrapped my arms around my belly, my protective instincts kicking in. Where were the nurses?

“Luke,” I yelled as I watch his hands came up to Harry’s chest, his tanned fingers wrapping around the soft material of the button up. Harry quickly pushed them back out of the way and stepped to block me more.

“Just because you’re fucking her doesn’t make you my baby’s father.”

Harry’s entire body froze with Luke’s comment and I saw that he was struggling to not react to what he said. Normally I could read Harry so easily but looking at him from the side now I couldn’t tell what part of Luke’s sentence upset him more. The vulgar comment about us having sex or the insult that Nora wasn’t his.

I wanted to reach out and grab him. I wanted to hug him and hold him close while I whispered in his ear that I loved him and so did Nora. With how much she reacted to Harry’s voice I had no doubt she would be Harry’s girl despite who her dad was on paper.

A small scream leaves my mouth and I quickly move my hand up to cover the sound. The room that had been peaceful and quite only moments ago was now a loud mess. Luke had shoved Harry backwards causing him to knock back into the bed, jostling me sharply with the movement. Nurses and security rushed into the room at the commotion and Harry was trying to keep his hands out of the fight. Harry’s little reaction to the situation didn’t stop Luke and he threw himself at Harry and as he did his fingers caught around the drip, yanking it from my arm as he and Harry went tumbling to the hard ground.

I cried out at the stinging feeling which caused both Luke and Harry to freeze on the floor. The pushed at each other as they fought to get their feet, eyes sliding over to me as they forgot about each other. Both of them moved to comfort me but Harry moved a second faster, speedily grabbing a bit of gauze, pressing it tightly over the inside of me elbow where the needle just was and it had started to bleed with how roughly it was removed.

Security had come in at some point, dragging Luke back out of the room as he profusely apologised to me, while also trying to get security to let him go but they weren’t having it and moments later it was just Harry at my side again along with a young nurse.

“No,” I whimpered, a steady stream of tears sliding down my cheeks as another security guard wrapped his hand around Harry’s arm and started to pull him from the room as well.

“No, not him.” The nurse said as she pushed a small hand against the security’s chest to get him to let go of Harry.

The security guard nodded at her after a short second, he gave Harry a look up and down, checking he was doing anything wrong before finally leaving the room. I only half registered that Luke was still yelling from outside the room because Harry’s hand pressed down hard on my arm to stop the blood.

“Breathe Evie,” He said out of breath, fingers massaging soft circles into my elbow.

My heart was thrashing against my chest, my breathing was tight and everything hurt. What the fuck was that.

The nurse knocked Harry out of her way gently as she took my arm from him, moving so she had her own hand over the gauze. I watched her as she whispered something into Harry ear, he nodded in reply to what she said eyes still locked on me.

Harry shifted himself up onto the bed, his hip pressing into mine as he reached over my quivering body to take my hand into his own shaking one. With his other hand he cupped my cheek, thumb swiping over my cheekbone forcing me eyes to stay on him instead of drift over to where the nurse was getting ready to put the IV back in.

“Look at me Evie bear.” He whispered, his breathes slow, structured and deep trying to get me to mimic them but it wasn’t working. It felt like there was a binding around my neck, stopping any air getting in. My anxiety had me in choke hold that wasn’t anywhere close to loosening its reigns. “Tell me about the time you broke your arm.”

“What?” I questioned a little confused to where he was going. My eyes flickered around the room wondering if he was being serious and the trauma of what happened hadn’t sent me off my rocker.

“Grace took you to that party, remember?” His hand soothed through my hair that was resting on the flat pillow. The touch was soft but wasn’t enough to stop this crippling anxiety attack.

“She didn’t tell dad.” I said my mind being drawn back to one of the most prominent memories I had of my father. “She lied and said she would take me to see the new Harry Potter because he wouldn’t let her go a party and then one of her friends knocked me down the porch steps and I landed on my arm.”

I smiled a little, a twitch of my lips at most as I leant into Harry’s touch on my cheek. I’d only told him this story once, ages ago when I first met him, I couldn’t believe that he remembered it. Not only remember it but remember how much the memory meant to me.

“Please don’t tell dad.” Grace begged as we rounded the last corner only a few houses from our own.

 

I frowned looking down at my arm that I kept cradled close to my chest. My tears had long since dried up but there was still a stinging pain and an engulfing heat coursing through my entire arm. It was nowhere near my heart but I swore I felt the beat of it around my elbow. I knew it was broken, it had to be there was no way that it could possibly hurt this much without being broken.

 

“I think he’s going to notice.”

 

Dad was like a bomb dog. He sniffed out when Grace and I were up to something the second we thought about it. It was a surprise that she got this far tonight without him figuring out what she had planned.

 

I was right as soon as we walked through the door we saw dad, just shy of steam coming out of his ears, angry as he wore a path into mum’s favourite rug in the living area. His gaze landed on Grace first eyes flaming, mouth open ready to yell before he flicked his heated gaze to me and on my arm. All the anger disappeared from his eyes in that second.

 

“Grace, go to bed.” He said sternly, eyes going back to Grace.

 

Grace rolled her eyes but did as he said, drunkenly stumbling as she made her way to the stairs and dad swore under his breath as he watched her. Once Grace had made it half way up the stairs dad rushed over to me taking my arm softly in his hands and shushing me gently when I whimpered.

 

“What happened Evie bear?”

 

“Ashley was drunk and knocked me down the stairs.”

 

Dad frowned, not saying anything back as he helped me out of my jacket. Once my jacket was pulled off I saw the full extent and dad swore again. It was bright red and swollen and I cried out as dad poked it tenderly with his fingers.

 

“Okay, sweetheart I think we need to go to the hospital.” He grabbed my jacket from where he sat it down and draped it back over my shoulders, quickly going in search of his car keys.

 

“I’m so sorry,” I cried grabbing my wrist again to keep my arm safely against my chest.

 

“It’s not your fault Evie bear.” He came over to me, arm looping around my shoulders to pull me into a loose hug so he wouldn’t hurt my arm any more. He leaned down so he was height was better matched to mine. Gently he peppered some soft kisses to my forehead that made my tears stop right then and there. “Let’s get you to the hospital and get you all better.”

I chocked on a small sob as I clenched my eyes shut. It was five years ago but it could have been yesterday with how prominent the memory was. I could still feel the soft kiss against the side of my head and it helped to relax me. I felt Harry move beside me so he was on the bed and then his lips gently pressed to my temple and I smiled softly.

“Feel better?” He asked and slowly I opened my eyes back up to him.

Taking in a deep steady breathe I chuckled a little. I felt so much better. Still a little worked up and emotional but I could breathe and the heart rate monitor had stopped it’s incessant beeping. Harry was smiling as he moved a hand to rub it over my belly.

“How did you know that would calm me down?”

Harry shrugged, fingers locking with mine as I put them over his. “Know how much you loved your parents and I wanted you to concentrate on something else, something good and that made you happy.”

I chuckled cuddling into as side the best I could with the new drip and the restrictions of the hospital bed. “That hurt a lot but he was so soft and caring. Cried at the hospital and everything.” I slowed taking in a steadying breathe before I continued. “I love you Harry. Thank you for coming.”

.-.-.-..

So sorry this took forever to come, I haven’t been motivated at all to edit it this so blame depression, shes a bitch. Next chapter, I am rewriting so it might take a little longer to post, but chapter 9 is almost finished and chapter 10 just needs an update. We’re in the home stretch now, tell me what you think.

“Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.” ― Martin Luther King Jr., A Testament of Hope: The Essential Writings and Speeches

“Are you okay?” Gemma asked me for what felt like the millionth time this morning.

Harry had been gone for a few weeks now while he did the South American leg of the tour. I was scared and a little nerve wracked on being without him after Luke showed up but I knew he had a job to do so I had to be okay. Gemma, Anne and Grace were taking it in turns to keep me company – more like babysit me – because Liz had become concerned about my blood pressure being high and telling me that I should be resting as much as possible. Resting was not easy for me.
